meanings.definition: Having a single form or shape.
meanings.sent1: The monomorphic flower had a perfectly round shape.
meanings.sent2: The artist preferred to paint monomorphic objects with simple shapes.
meanings.sent3: The monomorphic cloud looked like a giant cotton ball in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her monomorphic hairstyle never changed, always sleek and straight.
meanings.sent5: The monomorphic building stood out with its unique cube shape.

meanings.definition: Consisting of only one type or form.
meanings.sent1: The monomorphic species of fish all had the same color scales.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with monomorphic flowers, all red tulips.
meanings.sent3: The monomorphic cupcakes at the party were all decorated with blue frosting.
meanings.sent4: His wardrobe was monomorphic, only consisting of black t-shirts.
meanings.sent5: The monomorphic landscape was covered in endless fields of wheat.
